desc: We are looking to develop a UI interface which will be built on a data set that we will provide (attached). The UI must have options to select the family title/class title and commodity title at 3 different levels. The family title must be "Searchable & Auto-fill types". For example if there is a family title Machine Handling Equipment, when I start typing Machine, I should get options below of Machine Handling Equipment. Based on this selection, I should be able to select a class title and a commodity title. The UI back-end must also have a feature to manually tag certain search words into family title. For example, as an admin, I should be able to tag MHE as Machine Handling Equipment. This ways when a user types in MHE in the family title, he should get the auto-fill option as Machine Handling Equipment. Our Expectations: You give us the link to the UI, we play with it and after we find the best UI, we will pay only for that UI and get the back-end code for this. Again, payment will be made only to the best UI and not to all UI's. Feel free to message should you have any clarifications.
title: UI interface

desc: I need  an iPhone/iPad app.  I would like it designed and built.  I need an uber like app built for grocery delivery. Users will select a nearby grocery store and specify what groceries they require. Once completed the user can select to have it delivered as soon as possible or schedule a time. An active driver will be assigned to pick up the groceries and pay for them. Once delivered the driver's connected bank account will be credited with the amount of the groceries and their delivery fee, which will vary based on the amount of groceries purchased. The user will be charged a service fee which will include the driver's delivery fee and the service charge to the app owner. Drivers will need access to the app from a separate "driver" perspective and must have the ability to become active or go inactive. I realize this will be more complicated than what has been stated but further details can be discussed.

desc: We are a 70+ year old manufacturing company.  We manufacture pneumatic and hydraulic cylinders.  [url removed, login to view] - We have used a custom pricing/quoting and Engineering program for 20+ years and are trying to get away from that older, custom piece of software.  We would like a quoting/pricing Excel Spreadsheet tool that is user friendly to our internal staff.  The pricing tool would pull information from an existing 70+ page price sheet in Excel tables.  The pricing tool be user friendly, and ideally from a user standpoint, you could enter our Lynair model code (see attachment-model code) from drop-down menus (perhaps) and the pricing would be built in the background as you build a Lynair model number (see attachment-model code).  Once this project is complete, we would love to take it a step further even, and possibly create an App for our Reps (people that sell our product across the US) so they could access basic pricing on the fly/out in the field with their customers.  In addition to the pricing tool, we would like the spreadsheet to use tables, that we have, to do some basic Engineering calculations that could be printed  on our Production order (that circulates our Shop Floor) showing certain lengths of a few components (see attachment-shop order, at bottom of the order).
title: Design Pricing & Engineering Spreadsheets for Manufacturing Company
